questions.stem: Which of the following is a physical change?
questions.explanation: Melting of ice is a physical change as it only changes the state of water without forming a new substance

questions.stem: What is the mode of nutrition in green plants?
questions.explanation: Green plants are autotrophs as they make their own food through photosynthesis

questions.stem: Which tissue transports water and minerals in plants?
questions.explanation: Xylem tissue is responsible for transporting water and minerals from roots to other parts of the plant

questions.stem: The SI unit of temperature is:
questions.explanation: Kelvin (K) is the SI unit of temperature

questions.stem: Which component in a simple electric circuit provides the energy?
questions.explanation: Battery provides the electrical energy in a simple circuit

questions.stem: What happens when light rays fall on a plane mirror?
questions.explanation: Plane mirrors cause regular reflection where all reflected rays are parallel

questions.stem: Which of these is an acid?
questions.explanation: Citric acid found in citrus fruits is an acid

questions.stem: What instrument measures atmospheric pressure?
questions.explanation: A barometer is used to measure atmospheric pressure

questions.stem: Which gas is released during photosynthesis?
questions.explanation: Oxygen is released as a byproduct during photosynthesis

questions.stem: What is the function of white blood cells?
questions.explanation: White blood cells (WBCs) help fight infections in the body

questions.stem: Which soil has the highest water retention capacity?
questions.explanation: Clay soil has the highest water retention capacity due to its small particle size

questions.stem: What type of motion does a swing exhibit?
questions.explanation: A swing shows periodic motion as it moves back and forth regularly

questions.stem: Which part of the flower develops into fruit?
questions.explanation: The ovary of the flower develops into fruit after fertilization

questions.stem: What causes winds to blow?
questions.explanation: Winds blow from high pressure areas to low pressure areas

questions.stem: Which organ removes excess water and salts from blood?
questions.explanation: Kidneys filter blood and remove excess water and salts as urine

questions.stem: What is the process of conversion of water vapor to water called?
questions.explanation: Condensation is the process where water vapor turns into liquid water

questions.stem: Which layer of the atmosphere contains the ozone layer?
questions.explanation: The ozone layer is found in the stratosphere

questions.stem: What is the role of decomposers in an ecosystem?
questions.explanation: Decomposers break down dead organic matter and return nutrients to the soil

questions.stem: Which metal is used in thermometers?
questions.explanation: Mercury is traditionally used in thermometers due to its uniform expansion

questions.stem: What is the basic unit of life?
questions.explanation: The cell is the basic structural and functional unit of life

questions.stem: Which gas is needed for rusting of iron?
questions.explanation: Oxygen is necessary for iron to rust (oxidize)

questions.stem: What type of teeth are used for cutting food?
questions.explanation: Incisors are the front teeth used for cutting food

questions.stem: Which material is the best conductor of heat?
questions.explanation: Copper is an excellent conductor of heat

questions.stem: What is the process of loss of water from plant leaves called?
questions.explanation: Transpiration is the loss of water vapor from plant leaves

questions.stem: Which chamber of the heart pumps blood to the body?
questions.explanation: The left ventricle pumps oxygenated blood to the rest of the body

questions.stem: What causes day and night on Earth?
questions.explanation: Earth's rotation on its axis causes day and night

questions.stem: Which part of the plant cell contains chlorophyll?
questions.explanation: Chloroplasts contain chlorophyll which is needed for photosynthesis

questions.stem: What is the pH of a neutral solution?
questions.explanation: A neutral solution has a pH of 7

questions.stem: Which weather instrument measures wind speed?
questions.explanation: An anemometer is used to measure wind speed

questions.stem: What is the main function of red blood cells?
questions.explanation: Red blood cells transport oxygen throughout the body
